result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casha Tiandra Griffin

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Casha Tiandra Griffin in court.  Attorney Timothy Lloyd Baldwin in court for Casha Tiandra Griffin.  Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court for Casha Tiandra Griffin. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. DE's amended motion to compel discovery. Arguments heard. Discussion held regarding availability of some of the requested discovery. ADA Krejcarek shall make any and all recordings of all law enforcement interviews with the DE available within 10 days of today's hearing. ADA Krjcarek shall contact the Milwaukee Sheriff's Department and request any investigatory reports pertaining to the DE or the Co-Def. Court will scheduled a status hearing to check on the status of the discovery request. Bond motion filed by DE. Arguments heard. For reasons set forth on the record the Court will deny the bond motion.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Deft's Amended Motion To Compel Discovery.
Amended Affidavit In Support of Deft's Motion To Compel Discovery.
Exhibit C
Amended Affidavit In Support of Deft's motion to Modify Conditions of Bond

Minutes:  10:36am.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Timothy Baldwin & Atty Andrew Gawronski.  VRC.  Defense counsel reports there are discovery issues; filed a motion to compel last evening as well as a bond motion.  Discussion held.  ADA Krejcarek will be happy to assist defense in obtaining the discovery via the software program utilized by Joint Services.  Court sets the case for motion hrg on 9/28/22 @ 2pm.  Court will hear bond motion and motion to compel (if still needed) at that time.  Dates for FPT will be set at that time.

10:17 AM Defendant Casha Tiandra Griffin appeared in custody with Attorney Timothy Lloyd Baldwin. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Attorney Baldwin's motion for bond reduction. Arguments heard. Court denies the motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
